reviews.review:
What I like the most about this game is that Elizabeth is a very helpful AI compared to other games. For example, I shoot at the marines in Halo due to them not being so helpful, (and it's fun to watch them dodge grenades). I do get anything good out of shooting Elizabeth, because you can't. She can save your life in many situations. 

I also like the vigors,(despite most of them being a little underpowered) that you can use in this game. The game isn't the game where you can run into battle with a shotgun without losing a lot of health. You need to take cover and attempt to shoot people, (unless you are playing on easy mode).
SO GOOD.
Amazing.

It's about 5 hours of a really engaging story and world. Then it ends. :<

If you are looking for an experience like none other, then you have found it. Simply put, one of the most entertaining, artistic, and fun RPG's ever made.
Game of the Year. Probably the best game I've ever played, even better than the original BioShock. Get it while it's 75% off!
Good combat, great story, awesome characters. I actually developed a crush on Elizabeth while playing the game. Highly recommend.
Such an amazing game.... that is all i have to say... like any bioshock game 10/10 AMAZING! Replay valued high aswell. LOVE IT!

Bioshock Infinite es uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en mi vida, la historia te tiene enganchado desde el primer instante, incluso más si jugaste el primer Bioshock aunque no importa si no lo jugaste ya que este juego se ubica antes de los eventos del primer juego, el gameplay puede ser algo confuso ya que las teclas usadas para algunas habilidades no son muy comunes en un juego de primera persona pero te acostumbras rápido, toda la ciudad de Columbia es una maravilla, sientes viva la ciudad con festejos y gente celebrando con un nivel de atención al detalle maravilloso, añadiendo un Soundtrack espléndido y original que no desentona con la atmósfera del juego, las actuaciones de voz en Inglés son de las mejores que he oído y el juego te deja saber que cada centavo que gastaste en él lo vale, para mí, uno de los mejores juegos de todos los tiempos.

This game is insultingly easy, even on the hardest difficulty.

The plot is a contrived mess; all booker's actions and accomplishments get wiped away on at least 2 occasions. What's even worse is that the game flirts with a plot that would have been infinitely more interesting (and comprehensible), before settling back on its garbage.
very boring combat and the story starts out so bland i didnt care to finish it

I want to love this game, but it just doesn't seem to like me. Unfortunately, I don't think this game plays well on all hardware setups. I have yet to get more than 30 minutes into this game before it decides it wants to crash on me. Highly dissapointing. There seems to be a small percentage of gamers who are having this issue, but if you aren't the unlucky few then I am sure this is a really fun game. The sad part is, even though gamers report these huge problems, they don't seem to ever get fixed. Some people have been waiting since release for a fix and still nothing. If anything I will think twice before buying something from this company again. It's really sad because the game looks so good.

BioShock Infinite is an incredible game on every gaming level. The graphics, the sounds, the actors, the ambience, the story, the cutscenes and the AI. It's one of the few games that I played start to finish. In fact, I could have played all of the DLCs right after that if I had them! A friend posted on Facebook that he wanted the new Bioshock DLC so that he could "... fall in love with Bioshock all over again." No joke. Yes. This is that sort of game. A lot of work went into this game and it becomes obvious the first few minutes of the game!

Not a fan of this one. The story results in assumptions that don't leave me with a satisfied feeling. There are too many plotholes for me to be satisfied there or the implications of the resulting ending. Several gameplay mechanics from the original Bioshock come back in Infinite which really make little sense. Levels are extremely linear despite sometimes being completely open for the player to explore. You might as well just go exactly where the game wants you to go and not explore. Overall, I was disappointed with the game.

This game is a great departure from Rapture, and the combat has been made much more varied and difficult. Sometimes you need a sniper rifle, other times a machine gun. The vigors are great transitions, save a few (flame grenade grossness), and the 1910s look is superb.

Bioshock Infinite is unequivocally one of the most amazing games I have ever played. Combat is relatively simplistic but the use of vigors and their various combos add an additional dimension to the fps elements that will be your bread and butter in most of the battles you will fight during the course of the game. It is enough to keep you entertained and can be quite challenging at times though at no point did I feel like the enemies were insurmountable. What really drives Infinite and the other Bioshock games though is the story and ambience. Columbia is a city birthed from the notion of American exceptionalism taken to the extreme and you can see it and feel it in every corner of the game world. The plot and story, particularly your relationship with Elizabeth, is incredibly well done and the ending will smack you in the face and leave you speechless. It comes together in such a way though that you can't help but be in awe. Bioshock Infinite is an amazing work and worthwhile for at least one play through for almost anyone who enjoys a good story.

Gráficamente el juego es de lo mejor. El diseño de personajes muy interesante (E intrigante). Con pocas horas de juego puedes sentir el gran trabajo que se ha dado en la ambientación, el diseño y la historia. Sin duda uno de los mejores juegos.
Definitely a good game. The plot is great and the gameplay is fun. The Columbia looks as gorgeous as Rapture did. All together I would very much recommend this game.

BioShock Infinite has one of the best story lines to any game I have ever played. It's bloody, gory, engaging, and very touching. It's impossible to not get hooked into the story! It is well worth the price and one of my most reccomended games! 10/10
Entertaining would definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a storyline game with a good amount of twists.
Rly nice! Played it twice! but u have to have a working brain to get the story.

I'm not usually one to fall in love with a games story. This one had me gripped though. The gameplay and firefights are interwoven with the storyline but are secondary to the story. Is that a bad thing? Absolutely not. I really felt immersed in this game. Something I haven't experienced from any game in a very long time. Does it do every single little thing perfect. No, but it sure as heck puts you in the seat of a really great experience.
Game is good. Get it.

I'll begin with the general statement: this is a very good, memorable game and it is worth purchasing.
Now onto what I thought about it.
Bioshock Infinite is a very impressive looking and sounding game. It invites you to a beautiful city above the clouds and fills it with enough life and sounds to make you want to take the time to linger and drink it all in. Very stunning. I found myself taking the time to appreciate all the fine points the designers put into make this game as immersive as possible. It feels believable. 
The story also unfolds brilliantly: its starts as both simple and idealistic - everything is as honest as it seems - but quickly hints at a darker undertones until the beauty and the beast are violently revealed. The story tears into you with the wolf dressed in sheep's clothing and demands that you confront it. Is everything still so beautiful now that you've seen what exactly lies beneath? There is also hope - a hope you are asked to hold on to even as the game does its best to wrestle it away from you.
Gameplay-wise, however, I didn't find Bioshock Infinite in any way special. It flowed nicely, had excellent pacing, and included some details that made the game memorable, but all told was a very simple First Person experience. Weapons are basic, powers are basic, gameplay is stream-lined enough not to get in the way of the player experience. Not necessarily a bad thing in this instance. 

All in all, truly enjoyable game deserving of high marks.
loved this game some people have said that the story is convoluted but i loved it from begining to end. still playing through the dlc at the moment as i don't wanna rush it but well worth the money.

incredibly overrated in almost every way.  the only nice thing about it is the concept of a floating city however its execution is lacking.  the so called legendary eliabeth is nothing more then a poor mechanic reminding the player they suck at rescource mangement and might as well have a house in the middle of uncanney valley.

i only got it as it came with xcom, but to be honest not even that dispell the bitter aftertaste

verdict: dont bother.
Bioshock was always a magical experience for me, something a lot of games lack now a days, and this game by no means disappoints.

This is an amazing experience to behold, I spent 9 hours in my first playthrough and immediately started my second, good replayability, great story, and some decent dlc if you get bored with the amazing storyline

A real thriller!!!

O diretor Kevin Levine alcança o ápice de sua criação no sucessor de Bioshock. Com um enredo maravilhoso e repleto de simbologias, Booker e Elizabeth formam uma dupla perfeita onde suas personalidades são transportadas do jogo para a realidade, fazendo com que o jogador possa sentir cada momento da narrativa que é contada por situações, no geral, maestralmente elaboradas. O sistema de combate é simples, bastante dinâmico e divertido, o que pode ocasionar em uma certa repetitividade de ação que, mesmo sendo monótona em determinadas partes, tudo é ofuscado por uma fantástica história que cativa e impulsiona o jogador a todo o momento. Como um livro cujo o fim nunca queremos que termina e, ao ler a última página, as palavras reverberam por anos - senão para todo o sempre - Bioshock Infinite consegue promover a mesma sensação de infinito, de que a história nunca irá deixar o jogador e aqueles momentos, vivenciados intensamente com a maior riqueza gerada por personagens tão marcantes, permanecerá na mente e na reflexão para muito além do jogo.

Irrational Games once again manages to capture the mind in this thrilling mind-bender of a game. The game is beautifully paced, tailored just to lull you into a false sense of safety before rending it from you at the last second. The story is top-notch, the gameplay is tight and responsive, and Booker and Elizabeth are a duo to fear. Also, gotta love the Luteces. Just as good as the original Bioshock, and I'd expect nothing less.
Отличная игра!!Интересное начало ,захватывающий сюжет и  трогательная концовка .!(

As a great man once said, "Everytime I cum, I produce a quartz." The same can not be said for this game, there was no quartz cumming involved and I was personally extremely saddened to see this game make that choice. What really sets this game back is the distinct lack and obvious work around the devs did when making this game. In the demo Elizabeth's tits were at least twice the size but in this game they're like half. They used to be fucking watermelons and now they are merely saggy lemons, anybody would think she's just a typical lemon whore, why would any sane person change that? THIS GAME DOESN'T EVEN HAVE BOOB PHYSICS! After touching myself furiously to the first few demos this game released it was clear that the full release game was not intended to be an extended means of masturbation, which as you can imagine sadened many a poor boy. After crying to my daddy on the telephone, "how long now?" I was stricken with the realization that perhaps I could still one rub one out to Elizabeth, even with the lack of breasts that she had once obtained. So I poured myself a glass of fruit loops and let my hand fall into my pants. Elizabeth did not get me going for a second, but there was a shiny knight waiting for me, his name is Booker and I'll tell you what, that man has a lovely jaw line. I have now racked up 320 hours of gameplay on this game and are still yet to finish. 

Tits: 1/10
Booker's Calf definition: 10/10
Boob Physics: 0/10
Story: 2/10
Graphics: 1/10
Gameplay: 1/10

Overall: 10/10

Great game!!! this game really draws the user in from the start and keeps them in by all the little twists and turns in the plot. It was a shock to be away from rapture but it has worked really really well. The graphics i take my hat off to are amazing and cannot be criticised.

Although all that said there were points in the game where i wanted to pretend they didnt happen but im afraid they did. For instance at the start at the lighthouse the puzzle to the door, i believe that was arbotary and really could have done without. Yes it maybe there due to the security as Columbia is not just some place everyone is allowed, but i would have prefered a little harder puzzle or dialogue at that scene.

Overall great game 8/10 recomend purchasing, im actually away to buy burail at sea, cant wait :D!!!!
